meanings.sent1: Nobody was at the park today.
meanings.sent2: There was nobody in the room when I entered.
meanings.sent3: When the teacher asked who broke the vase, nobody claimed responsibility.
meanings.sent4: In the vast desert, it seemed as if nobody had ever set foot there before.
meanings.sent5: The dark alley was so quiet that nobody dared to walk through it.

meanings.definition: A person of no importance or authority.
meanings.sent1: The new intern felt like a nobody among the seasoned employees.
meanings.sent2: He was treated like a nobody by the arrogant celebrity.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, he jokingly dressed up as a 'nobody' with a cape and mask.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, he felt like a nobody lost in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The villain in the story was portrayed as a nobody who rose to power unexpectedly.
